question: Why is the North sometimes called the 'Land of the Midnight Sun'?
possible_answers: A. It is closer to the Sun.
B. The Northern lights appear at midnight.
C. It is night most of the time.
D. Summer daylight can last up to 24 hours.
main_question: Why is the North sometimes called the 'Land of the Midnight Sun'?
answer: D. Summer daylight can last up to 24 hours.
explanatory_sentence: The North is often referred to as the “Land of the Midnight Sun” because at the height of summer, daylight can last up to 24 hours.
